summary: The term "United Nations Conference," redirected to "UN Conference," encompasses various international gatherings convened under the auspices of the United Nations to address pressing global issues. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, these conferences play a pivotal role in shaping international agreements and fostering multilateral cooperation. The EU actively participates in UN Conferences to promote its values and policies, influencing global governance and international law. These engagements facilitate dialogue on critical matters such as climate change, human rights, and security, thereby reinforcing the EU's commitment to collaborative solutions in international affairs.
